title: What’s Happening in Space Policy September 17-24, 2023
summary: Here is SpacePolicyOnline.com’s list of space policy events for the week plus a day of September 17-24, 2023 and any insight we can offer about them. The House and Senate […]

title: Using Webb, scientists discover carbon dioxide and methane in habitable-zone exoplanet
summary: Using the joint NASA/European Space Agency/Canadian Space Agency James Webb Space Telescope, scientists have discovered the presence of carbon-bearing molecules within the atmosphere of exoplanet K2-18 b. Methane and carbon dioxide are among these carbon-bearing molecules.

title: New Soyuz Crew Arrives at ISS — Six Months Later Than Planned
summary: A new Russian-American crew has arrived on the International Space Station as part of a rather unusual crew rotation. The three people aboard Soyuz MS-24 were supposed to launch six […]

title: New ISS crew arrives on Soyuz
summary: A Soyuz spacecraft delivered a new crew to the International Space Station Sept. 15 as NASA and Roscosmos updated plans for later missions.

title: General Atomics acquires electro-optical sensor supplier EO Vista
summary: Defense contractor General Atomics announced Sept. 15 it acquired EO Vista, a supplier of space and airborne electro-optical sensors.
